control.name: ceCloseOnOuterMouseClick
control.description: This check box controls whether the popup window should be closed when clicking a non-focusable control within the form.

control.name: icbShowDropDown
control.description: This combo box allows you to select how the popup control behaves when an end-user clicks within its text region.

control.name: cePopupSizeable
control.description: This check box controls whether an end-user can resize the dropdown window by dragging its bottom right corner.

control.name: ceShowPopupCloseButton
control.description: This check box shows or hides the popup window's close button.

control.name: ceShowPopupShadow
control.description: This check box shows or hides the popup window's shadow.

control.name: popupContainerEditSample
control.description: The QueryPopUp and QueryResultValue events are raised when the editor's popup window is about to be opened and closed, respectively. The first event is handled to initialize the controls contained within the popup window. The second event is handled to update the editor's value based on the state of the controls that reside within the popup.

hint.name: popupContainerEditSample
hint.hinttext: #KeyboardALT+DOWN, F4 to show or hide the dropdown window#Other End-User ActionsUse the controls on the right pane to learn which additional end-user customization methods are available
